result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Ramon Luna

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Ramon Luna in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Juan Ramon Luna.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State. Defense request a Plea/Sentencing date. 
Defense  advised to the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 


Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Ramon Luna in court with Attorney Katherine Graber; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Juan Ramon Luna in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Juan Ramon Luna in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Ramon Luna appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
